intro: Massowia canniformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves that are typically narrow and pointed. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Massowia canniformis is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of slow-moving water bodies.
